meanings.sent1: After just one beer, he felt a bit drunkish.
meanings.sent2: She seemed drunkish after sipping on the cocktail.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the vase and stumbled around, looking drunkish.
meanings.sent4: The flickering streetlight cast a drunkish glow on the dark alley.
meanings.sent5: The smell of alcohol on his breath made it clear he was drunkish.

meanings.sent1: His slurred speech made it obvious he was drunkish.
meanings.sent2: The stumbling man was clearly drunkish as he tried to walk straight.
meanings.sent3: The clown's wobbly dance moves made him appear drunkish to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The flickering neon sign gave the bar a drunkish vibe.
meanings.sent5: The dim lighting in the room made everyone's flushed faces look drunkish.

meanings.definition: In a state of mild drunkenness
meanings.sent1: She felt a bit drunkish after celebrating with champagne.
meanings.sent2: The partygoers were all in a drunkish state by the end of the night.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy toddler stumbled around the room, looking drunkish from exhaustion.
meanings.sent4: The swirling colors of the painting gave it a drunkish appearance.
meanings.sent5: The warm, fuzzy feeling in his head signaled he was getting drunkish.
